title: Federal Judge Blocks Gulf of Mexico Drilling Leases, Citing Environmental Concerns
sub_head: The Interior Department sold the oil-and-gas leases in November, but they had yet to take effect
body:
A federal judge invalidated a lease sale of 80 million acres in the Gulf of Mexico that the U.S. Department of Interior had made available for oil and gas drilling in November, saying regulators used flawed environmental analysis.
In a 68-page ruling on Thursday, Judge Rudolph Contreras of the U.S. District Court in Washington, D.C., called the federal agency’s error in its environmental-impact determination “a serious failing.”
